text.section: In Montgomery County and Prince George's County, the county executive and county council may adopt regulations concerning the Commission's entry into or use of a public roadway for which a permit is required.

section.section:
The review and approval procedures authorized by subsection (b)(2) of this section:
may require review and approval by the county before the Commission issues the permit; and
may not result in any cost to the Commission or to the public utility.
A permit issued by the Commission under § 27-108 of this title is not effective unless the appropriate county approves the permit.

The Commission:
shall give a county advance notice of the date, time, and extent to which the Commission plans to cut into a public roadway, sidewalk, or other public property of the county; and
if required by a regulation adopted under this section, shall:
submit a copy of proposed construction plans to the county before construction begins; and
apply for and obtain a permit from the county at no cost to the Commission.
The county shall promptly process the Commission's permit application.
The issuance of a permit under this section constitutes approval of the Commission's proposed construction as specified in the permit.
If the construction under this section is an emergency, the Commission shall notify the appropriate county as soon as practicable after the cut.

text.section:
On prior notice, the county may:
make all necessary final repairs to restore property to a condition satisfactory to the county; and
charge all costs for the final repairs to the Commission or to the public utility that made the entry on the property.
